Most "lag" in KSP is caused by the CPU bottlenecking on physics calculations.

In the settings there is a slider called Max Physics Delta Time, sliding it to the right will slow down the simulation and give you a slightly better framerate.

Other than that, there's nothing you can do except buy a better processor. Even the fastest modern processors reach a point where they choke with KSP though because it doesn't have proper multi-core support.

repeat so i can understand sorry i dont know a lot about technical stuff but also how i can fix?

Most programs are like a 4 lane highway. cars can travel in all 4 lanes at once and traffic flows smoothly.

KSP forces 4 lanes worth of cars into one lane, like a construction zone. Except this construction zone never ends and there is traffic for all eternity.

The thing is, even the best laptops these days will still struggle with KSP. It's not really designed for laptops, although Squad do what they can to make it playable. Laptops almost always have terrible cooling systems due to their compact size which severely restricts airflow, making the processor and graphics card overheat far more easily. As a result, laptop hardware has to be limited such that it doesn't use too much power or simply overheat from the strain of trying to process all the data. One thing you can try is changing the power options to High Performance whilst you play KSP. It might help a little.
thanks guys, thanks for the help. i am now scared about the highway blockage inside my laptop

Another thing to look. If you have the ISA Mapsat Mod installed, Turn off its mapping functions when you're not actually flying a mapping probe. It can cause lag because the plugin is active. Also turn it off before you launch something with a ISA mapping dish installed as it will cause the game to lag and stutter.
